contentrichtext.text: '''Ulisse Stacchini''' (July 3, 1871 â€“ 1947) was an [[Italy|Italian]] architect. He was born [[Florence]] and studied in Milan and died in [[Sanremo]]. His major works include the [[Milan Central Station]] and [[Stadio Giuseppe Meazza]]. == External links == * [http://www.artnet.com/library/08/0808/T080826.asp Page at artnet.com] {{Authority control|VIAF=10929892}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Stacchini, Ulisse | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Italian architect | DATE OF BIRTH = July 3, 1871 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 1998 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Stacchini, Ulisse}} [[Category:1871 births]] [[Category:1947 deaths]] [[Category:People from Florence]] [[Category:Italian architects]] {{Italy-architect-stub}}
